name: Sofitel So Mauritius

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: just spent 6 nights at this wonderful new luxury resort at bel ombre, on the south coast of mauritius. A very undeveloped area of the island, with a beautiful backdrop of the mountains and sugar plantations, surrounding the resort. On arrival, you look down the hill to the resort - to the ocean - and taken by a golf car to the rooms. The resort is low rise, so no floors to climb, and each room is a luxury villa. We had a beautiful room, contemporary with a huge double bed, beauitful linen, stunning bathroom, flatscree, wifi, movies, bose system, outdoor and indoor shower, a lovely eco garden outside your floor to ceiling patio doors which you can pull right open, with an outdoor bath, your own butler, so look after your every wim .... restaurants were great, the food absolutely outstanding, we had dinner every night at the hotel - very cool beach front restaurant. Beautiful beach with stunning lounge furniture. Lovely infinity pool overlooking the sea. The spa area was just beautiful, we both had massages, plus a yoga pavilion.
reviews.title: Luxurious outstanding new resort different to any other hotel you will find in mauritius

reviews.text: Nothing i could fault on this stay. I noticed on some other comments, about th vegetation, it must of rained a lot since January as the gardens are maturing well.
reviews.title: I didn't miss home!

reviews.text: Compared to other luxury hotels we have seen on the island, this hotel is so stylish, so unique, every attention to detail has been thought through, for us this was one of the nicest resorts we have ever stayed in,and would highly recommend to anyone that enjoys luxurious resorts, amazing food, lovely and attentive mauritian staff, cool cocktails (try the mahito specials), a great wine list, a beautiful spa, and fantastic beach bar restaurant.
reviews.title: Island life at it's best

reviews.title: Very good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place truly is a home away from home. I couldn't be happier with my stay. This hotel is still in its pre-opening stage and I was informed that their opening is in April. The staff are young and verrry friendly. They memorise your name from Day 1 and wish you using your name. This is called personalised service. My personal butler, Ravi, was always available. He set the tone of my stay right from the beginning. The staff at the restaurants went out of their way when I asked told them that I wanted to try the local Mauritian food, which was not on the menu. The chef prepared a special meal plan for me for the duration of my stay and I had different local dishes served for dinner every night. The staff at the Bar Le Takamaka were helpful too. They had good knowledge of the drinks. For lunch, La Plage is highly recommended. It is very relaxing to sit there and enjoy your meal overlooking the sea. It is on the beach with sand so you dont have to wear your slippers or come in formal clothes; very non-pretentious. I did not use the Spa or the pool although I visited them and looked very inviting.
reviews.title: Transperent water worlds Beautiful beaches

aka: Sofitel So Mauritius Bel Ombre Hotel
description: Sofitel So Mauritius Bel Ombre is located on the southern tip of the island in the most naturally beautiful place. The resort has 92 suites and villas, 2 restaurants, 2 bars, So Spa, So Fit. The resort also has a tennis court, kids club, outdoor swimming pool, 520 mts of beach, natural lagoon and corals, boat house with water activities and 24 hrs personal butler service.
